Members of the Army and police forces are witnessed abusing Somali refugees.

Somali Islamist rebels stormed a remote police camp in northeastern Kenya, killing seven people and kidnapping three. The town was four miles from the border and known as Gerille. Among the dead were three police, a civil servant, school teacher and a pregnant woman.

Somali Islamist rebels stormed a remote police camp in northeastern Kenya, killing seven people and kidnapping three. The town was four miles from the border and known as Gerille. Among the dead were three police, a civil servant, school teacher and a pregnant woman.

Kenyan police said they had seized explosive equipment in a refugee camp near the Somali border, calling it a major breakthrough in their investigation into attacks blamed on rebels linked to al Qaeda.
At six people, including three children, were killed in a tribal clash over grazing land and other resources in northeast Kenya near the Ethiopian border.
Two Kenyan government officials escaped death narrowly after the car in which they were patrolling in missed a remote controlled explosive device in the eastern town of Mandera bordering Somalia.

Clashes continue between the Tugen and Pokot communities in Baringo county. Escalation of hostilities since January has, according to the Kenya Red Cross Society (KRCS), left more than 7,500 Tugen people displaced from their homes, living either with other members of their community or in rudimentary shelters in the bush.
A gunman opened fire Sunday at a refugee camp in eastern Kenya, killing a refugee leader before escaping in the second such incident in a week.
Three suspected members of the Al-Qaeda were shot and killed by security forces. A number of AK-47s were recovered.
A member of Al Shabaab shoots and kills a UNHCR official in a refugee camp. Five were later arrested.
A grenade wounds six in a border town. Residents and authorities suspect Al Shabaab.
Police arrest four members of Al Shabaab who planned attacks on churches over Christmas.
Police arrest four members of Al Shabaab who planned attacks on churches over Christmas.
A remote controlled blast in a refugee camp kills one police officer and injures two others.

Hundreds of protesters, some armed with spears, clashed with police and burned barricades to block one of the main tourist routes into Masai Mara game reserve. The demonstrators are angry about a park revenue deal between the local council and a commercial bank.
Nine military officers injured and one police officer killed in twin al Shabaab explosions. The single fatality was in Mandera.
Nine military officers injured and one police officer killed in twin al Shabaab explosions.
Al Shabaab fighters raid a police camp and make away with weapons.

Kenyan police arrested five men suspected of being members of Somalias al Qaeda-linked al Shabaab insurgents on the island of Lamu, close to where two tourists were kidnapped and taken to Somalia earlier in the year.

At least 12 soldiers were injured and one dead after a military vehicle they were boarding was hit by a land mine in Mandera, a town in northern Kenya bordering Somalia and Ethiopia. Al Shabaab is believed to be responsible.
Grenade blasts at a restaurant kills six and injures 15.
Assailants, believed to be Somali pirates, abduct six fisherman of the coast of Malindi.
Kenyan police make a second raid in the same area and kill 12 suspected al Shabaab fighters, and arrest several more.
A landmine blast kills a civilian and a police officer near a camp. Al Shabaab is believed to be responsible.
Kenyan police kill six al Shabaab fighters, wound six others and make several arrests during a raid.
Gunmen attack a police station and government vehicle.
Kenyan police arrest 50 al Shabaab suspects in the northeast.
A grenade attack at a church killed two civilians.
A Kenyan Naval vessel sinks and fishing boat, killing 7, near the border with Somalia when it failed to identify itself upon request, believing they were al Shabaab.
A Kenyan is dead and two Swiss tourists are injured when their vehicle came under attack by armed men, assumed to be involved with al Shabaab.
Kenyan youths gather to protest against the recent activities of al Shabaab.
Kenyan police arrest 20 suspects believed to be in connection with an attack on a bus which killed four people.
A roadside style bomb explodes near a military transport wounding four passengers. Al Shabaab believed to be involved.
Four civilians are killed when unknown assailants, believed to be affiliated with al Shabaab, attack a bus. Conflicting reports have eight deaths.
Police arrest one man believed to be in connection with the twin bombings. Many weapons were found in the position of the man. He later admitted to be involved with al Shabaab.
Al Shabaab detonates an explosive at an Nairobi disco and injures 14 people.
At least one person was killed and 10 were wounded Monday in a grenade attack at a bus stop in central Nairobi, the second such incident in less than a day.
'A national staffer of an INGO was killed in mob violence and arson during tribal clashes.'
Six suspected Somali pirates were killed in a fierce gun battle with Kenya Navy personnel patrolling the Kenya-Somalia territorial waters at Kiunga.
Kenyan police arrest two British citizens who were attempting to cross into Somalia. The police believed they may have been providing information to al Shabaab.

Unidentified Somali gunmen abduct two refugees and two Spanish doctors from a refugee camp near Somalia. Kenyan authorities increase their presence along the border and send military patrols into Somalia in response.
Police and Navy forces peruse a group of Somali gunmen and kidnappers of an elderly and disabled French woman who escaped by boat toward Somalia. The forces were able to surround the assailants.
An elderly French woman is kidnapped by an unknown group near where a British tourist was killed several weeks ago. Kenyan authorities pursue.

Suspected Al Shabaab killed a British man and kidnapped his wife in a raid on a remote beach resort known as Kiwayu Safari Village. The Kenyan military mobilizes troops along the border with Somalia in response.
Teachers strike, gather in Nairobi to protest pay.
A child is killed and three others injured when the group came across a hand grenade when they were grazing their animals.

A policeman was killed in Mandera and three others injured when suspected al Shabab insurgents attacked them with an explosive device on the Kenya-Somalia border. Three civilians were also killed in the blast.
Police forces arrest five suspected members of the al-Shabab militant organization.

actor1: Military Forces of the Republic of Congo (1997-)
notes: Kenyan authorities have arrested a Democratic Republic of Congo (Democratic Republic of Congo) rebel commander over the 2.5 tonne gold haul smuggled into the country.

Police fired tear gas at a group of about 100 protesters demonstrating against high food and fuel prices in a march through downtown Nairobi. The group was on their way to the offices of the President and the Prime Minister to make their grievances known. Eight arrested.

Two Somali refugees were killed and a dozen injured in clashes with police during riots which broke out at the overcrowded refugee camp. Police sought to disperse a crowd that was protesting an attempt to demolish illegal structures around a food distribution point. Teargas and live ammunition was used. Two refugees dead and a dozen injured.
Kenyan police and Somali refugees on Thursday clashed in Dhagahley refugee camp just north eastern Kenya killing at least two people and wounding 11 others.
Youths on Wednesday stormed the Milimani Law Courts to demand an explanation from the Chief Justice over a case involving National Youth Council (NYC) elections.
Hola Divisional Criminal Investigations Officer (DCIO) was on Wednesday night shot dead by thugs in Kahawa West, Nairobi.

Four villagers and six cattle thieves were killed overnight in clashes near Isiolo in central Kenya. Villagers confronted the raiders and there was an exchange of fire. Four of the villagers were shot dead and the six other dead are the raiders.

assoc_actor_2: PICK: Party of Independent Candidates of Kenya
notes: Unknown gunmen sprayed a vehicle belonging to Kilome MP Harun Mwau with bullets on City Hall Way Thursday night, ten days after he claimed threats had been made against his life.
Seven bandits killed in Turkana by security personnel in retaliation for an attack on a police camp in Turkana East earlier in the week.

On the evening of 20 June 2011 ONLF [rebel Ogaden National Liberation Front] Central Committee member was assassinated in Nairobi, Kenya, by intelligence operatives of the TPLF [Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, dominant party in Ethiopias ruling coalition] regime currently in power in Ethiopia. Mr Abdi Abdullahi was unarmed and alone when Ethiopian intelligence agents fired several shots killing him instantly.

On the evening of 20 June 2011 ONLF [rebel Ogaden National Liberation Front] Central Committee member was assassinated in Nairobi, Kenya, by intelligence operatives of the TPLF [Tigray Peoples Liberation Front, dominant party in Ethiopias ruling coalition] regime currently in power in Ethiopia.
An inspector with the Anti-Stock Theft Unit and a corporal with the Kenya Wildlife Service were shot dead in the raid on Lochakula security camp by more than 200 suspected Toposa raiders.

'A driver for an international aid agency was hit with a pistol on the forehead by armed Somalis who attacked him as he was coming out of his hotel. The attackers stole the vehice and fled across the Kenya-Somali border.'
Movement of forces: Security has been beefed up along the Kenya-Southern Sudan border following the killing of Turkana warriors in a botched cattle raid.
The death toll in an attack on Sunday by Sudanese Toposa militia at a village in Turkana North district in northern Kenya has risen to 11.
An explosion ripped through a street in the centre of the Kenyan capital Nairobi on Sunday, injuring dozens of people and sending ambulances and police rushing to the scene. Two people were killed.

Police are investigating an incident in which the Kitui mayor was beaten up at a public rally. In the incident that shocked the town, Mayor Alex Mwendwa Munyoki was dragged off the podium as he addressed the Sunday afternoon rally and beaten up, sustaining serious injuries.
Kenyan security forces are conducting security operations in Mandera after a vehicle belonging to Kenyan security forces was targeted with a bomb explosion last night. Four soldiers were killed.

Nine Turkana herders are feared dead following heavy gun battle with suspected Pokot raiders at Kotaruk location in Loima District, Turkana County. Among the dead are three women and six men who were gunned down when cattle rustlers attacked Ulukuse and Napak-ekali villages in Loima District.

Riot police dispersed members of the outlawed Mombasa Republican Council [MRC] who had camped outside the Mombasa Law Courts yesterday. The over 100 men were angered after being informed that the hearing of a case in which they are challenging the governments decision to outlaw the organization was halted.
Movement of forces: President Kibaki has ordered the military to intensify security patrols along Kenyan borders in the wake of an attack from a neighboring country.

A man was killed and two others are missing in street demonstrations that turned ugly after unidentified gunmen opened fire on protesters in Moyale town. Protesters were demonstrating against the rape of a 19-year-old girl by men suspected to be from a rival community on Sunday.

A man was killed and two others are missing in street demonstrations that turned ugly after unidentified gunmen opened fire on protesters in Moyale town. The attacker was then hacked to death by angry demonstrators.

A police constable shot his colleague before committing suicide. Constable Jacob Kipserem Rop was returning his G3 rifle to the armory after night duties when he quarreled with his boss, senior sergeant Hassan Yusuf, before shooting him dead.

Ethiopians who killed more than 20 people in Turkana have set base on Kenyan territory. The 900 Merilles, who are said to have been armed by their government, now occupy prime land on the Kenyan side of Lake Turkana and prevent Kenyans from setting foot there.
Hundreds of students and parents of a public secondary school in Nairobi took to the streets yesterday to protest attempts by the institutions trustees to privatize it.
Two more bombs were found in Ngong on Monday, a few hours after a fifth victim of Sundays blast died in hospital.

Four children were killed on Sunday and another seriously hurt when an explosive device they found in an empty field with went off. The device, which police described as an anti-personnel bomb -- the round fired from a mortar -- was almost certainly an unexploded munition from the nearby Ngong Range, used for training by the military and police.
Movement of forces: Military and police helicopters are being used to monitor the Kenyan coast over militant threats as fresh details emerged on how al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden was killed.
Five more people have been killed by suspected Merrile bandits from Ethiopia, two days after the militia executed 20 other Kenyans.
Suspected cattle rustlers from Ethiopia shot and hacked at least 38 people to death in neighboring Kenya. Eighteen people were killed at Todonyang.
In retaliation for an earlier attack, angry Turkana residents shot dead five Merrile militia in [a] retaliatory attack.
Police are investigating the killing of former NTV reporter Wambui Kabiru at her house in Nairobi. Her body was found on Sunday with marks on the neck, an indication she may have been strangled.

University students from West Pokot County on Thursday held a demonstration over alleged discrimination in the recruitment of employees by an international agency operating in the area. Carrying placards and twigs, the demonstrators blocked the Makutano-Kapenguira road, bringing traffic to a standstill as business people hurriedly closed their shops, fearing looting.
Three Kenyan fishermen were killed in Uganda in the disputed Kenya-Uganda border territory.

A multi-million-shilling mortuary and crematorium built in an estate in Ukunda, Kwale County, is at the centre of a storm. Residents, who held a demonstration in Mwakamba, said the mortuary was misplaced and did not go well with their religious and traditional beliefs.

Movement of forces: Kenyan authorities said they have heightened security in Nairobi and its environs following a terror alert warning that Somali militant group, Al Shabaab, have threatened to bomb social places particularly during the Easter holiday.

A few hundred activists and demonstrators took the streets of Kenyas two main cities Tuesday to protest against the skyrocketing cost of fuel and basic goods. In Nairobi, less than hundred people, mainly civil society members, turned out to vent their anger at the government, arguing that Kenyas leaders were spending the states resources on themselves and not the people.

A few hundred activists and demonstrators took the streets of Kenyas two main cities Tuesday to protest against the skyrocketing cost of fuel and basic goods. In the coastal city of Mombasa, a few hundred people mobilized by over 20 civil society groups marched to demand that the government move in to keep a lid on soaring prices.

Mombasa youth held a demonstration and named three Islamic preachers they claim should be arrested for recruiting youths to join Al-Shabab in Somalia. The demo started at Mama Ngina drive to the DCs where they presented a petition they wanted forwarded to the Internal Security Minister George Saitoti.

Two police officers are recuperating in a Nairobi hospital after suffering injuries during an eight-man gang attack in the sprawling Eastleigh suburb. Nairobi police boss Antony Kibuchi said the gang of eight men was 'heavily armed'.
Hundreds of Muslims on Tuesday held demonstrations in the streets of Mombasa following the death of a Muslim women in police custody before her remains were buried.
A Kenyan woman who was accused of harboring terror suspect Fazul Mohammed in Mombasa died in the coastal city on Monday night after allegedly being tortured by the police.

assoc_actor_1: KEMWA: Kenya Muslim Women Alliance; Women (Kenya)
notes: Hundreds of women in Mombasa [Coast Province] took to the streets protesting the increased cases of youths indulging in drug abuse and joining the Al-Shabab militia group.

Somalias Al-Shabab militia crossed into Kenya and attacked a police station. The attackers launched a rocket-propelled grenade on the Liboi Police Station at the Liboi border in, northeastern, but no injury was reported.

Two house built for the internally displaced in Burnt Forest in Uasin Gishu County [north Rift Valley Province] have been burnt down. The houses that were built were torched by unknown arsonist. The internally displaced persons [IDPs] say they no longer feel safer here, given the frequently arson attacks by unknown assailant.

As beach plots at the Coast continue to get into the hands of private developers, residents of Lamu County are battling over the remaining parcels of land. the MCCG community group led protesters in a peaceful demonstration as they attempted to block developers from demarcating land for development which they consider a conservation area.

More than 10 people were injured on Sunday during a demonstration over land meant for the resettlement of displaced persons. The demonstration had been planned by members of the Maasai community as a standoff between them and the government over the 2,400-acre land escalated. A group of youths pelted police officers with stones, injuring two of them. The law enforcers then descended on the protesters with clubs, injuring several of them. Running battles ensued.

Sporadic gunfire caused panic in Liboi town [northeastern Kenya, near border with Somalia] on Sunday night when the police and Al-Shabab militia were engaged in a shoot-out. Separate reports indicate that the militia crossed into Kenya on a revenge attack after they were repulsed by the GSU in Mandera following gun-fights between two rival clans in Somalia.

Youths attacked three members of a neighboring community to avenge what they termed as police brutality against them. The three were attacked by a group of Maasai youths and a motorcycle they were using set ablaze at Olepolos Village in Narok North District.
Police in Nanyuki have arrested a rogue officer who shot dead two colleagues and injured a third one on Saturday evening in Naro Muru.
On Thursday, 25 youths were arrested after they stormed a farm earmarked for IDP relocation as they tried to stop surveyors from erecting beacons.

Motorists were robbed and shops vandalized by university students protesting over the killing of a classmate by security guards. Protesters marched from Nairobi Universitys main campus in the city to Westlands, where they smashed windows at the club after they failed to enter. They lit tires outside the club where their classmate was injured after police prevented them from torching the building.

actor1: Military Forces of Kenya (2002-2013) General Service Unit
notes: A contingent of General Service Unit (GSU) officers crossed into Somalia and killed a dozen Al-Shabab militants in a clash at the Liboi border. Officers involved in the Tuesday [22 March] operation said suspected Al-Shabab militia fired to the camp and hit a water tank that is the only source of the vital commodity for the battalion.

More than 3,000 beach traders on Monday protested against the Tourism Bill, which they claim will render them jobless. The operators from different beaches of the coastline between Vanga and Kiunga held a peaceful demonstration at Jomo Kenyatta public beach to oppose the Bill.
A seven-year-old boy was killed while two others were injured in a mortar shell explosion in Mandera. The explosive is suspected to have been left behind after fighting by Somali factions.

Police on Monday used tear gas to disperse hundreds of Voi residents demonstrating against what they claimed were plans to settle internally displaced families in Taita-Taveta County. The demonstration was sparked by claims that more than 1,000 people were living in temporary shelter on a private farm in Taveta after efforts to settle them were opposed by the community.

Movement of forces: Kenya has deployed forces at the border with Somalia because of fears over possible attacks from Somalias Al-Shabab militants. Army spokesman Bogita Ongeri has said a big number of Kenyan forces have been deployed at the border in order to prevent any attacks from Al-Shabab militants, who threatened to attack Kenya.

A motor bomb was thrown on Monday night [14 March] in Mandera town and later followed by sporadic gunfire that lasted almost ten minutes from neighboring Bulawayo town on the border of Kenya and Somalia. Police said five residents were seriously injured. The incident came days after Al-Shabab warned that it would attack Kenya in retaliation for training soldiers for the Transitional Federal Government of Somalia.

A human rights organization has launched investigations into claims that security personnel mopping up illegal firearms in Tana North District raped women. Ms Sadia Hussein, a rights activist based in Tana River County alleged victims from Bulla Righa Village in Bura were raped last week and dozens of others have not turned up for medical assistance.

Movement of forces: Two unidentified military helicopters are reported having been deployed in Mandera military area and have been seen overflying Mandera and Bulo-Xawo without engaging AS forces on the ground.

Some 2,800 people have been displaced from their homesteads following fresh conflict between two communities in Tana River district. The worst hit areas are Bura, Madogo and Bangale where homesteads were burnt to the ground, forcing more than 2,000 residents to flee their homes.

Some 2,800 people have been displaced from their homesteads following fresh conflict between two communities in Tana River district. The worst hit areas are Bura, Madogo and Bangale where homesteads were burnt to the ground, forcing more than 2,000 residents to flee their homes.

Police on Monday used tear gas to disperse hundreds of dock workers who were heading to a Mombasa hotel to storm a port privatization workshop convened by the Kenya Ports Authority. The KPA stakeholders meeting at Mombasa Beach Hotel was meant to finalize Mombasa Port privatization exercise.

Movement of forces: Unconfirmed reports indicate that an AS battalion of elite forces has been deployed in Bulo-Xawo and that operatives from the AS intelligence services (Amniyat) were being deployed in Mandera town.

Thousands of families are fleeing Mandera town [in northeastern Kenya] following intense fighting that has been going on at the Kenya-Somalia border since Wednesday night. Eight people were struck by bullets fired by militiamen who have been fighting AU troops on the Somalia side. One Kenyan woman was killed.

Some 120 Oromo Liberation Front [OLF, Ethiopian] rebels have been arrested in a crackdown in northern Kenya. The operation was launched three months ago by Kenyan and Ethiopian forces to mop up illegal arms and secure the border.

Egerton University has been closed indefinitely following student riots. The students went on the rampage, destroying a dairy processing plant, a laboratory, a section of their lecture halls, the student mess among other buildings. They were protesting three days of power failure.

A bomb exploded at the Mandera District Hospital [northeastern Kenya] as heavy fighting continued on Kenyas border with Somalia and Ethiopia Thursday [24 February]. The explosion did not cause casualties, said North Eastern Provincial Commissioner [PC] James ole Serian, but four Kenyans were treated for bullet wounds.

Movement of forces: As fighting broke out between Ethiopian and Somali factions near the Kenya border, resulting in some Kenyans caught in the crossfire, a contingent of Kenya army battalion have been put on standby around Mandera town to protect residents.

The Special Programmes ministry on Tuesday denied planning to settle thousands of internally displaced people in the Coast region. But even as he issued the denial, a wave of protests swept through the counties at the Coast, with people saying the government was planning to relocate IDPs secretly.

The Special Programmes ministry on Tuesday denied planning to settle thousands of internally displaced people in the Coast region. But even as he issued the denial, a wave of protests swept through the counties at the Coast, with people saying the government was planning to relocate IDPs secretly.

The Special Programmes ministry on Tuesday denied planning to settle thousands of internally displaced people in the Coast region. But even as he issued the denial, a wave of protests swept through the counties at the Coast, with people saying the government was planning to relocate IDPs secretly.

International environmental groups, members of civil society and other concerned individuals on Sunday held a protest in Kenya to petition the Chinese government against financing the construction of Ethiopias controversial mega-dam.

Movement of forces: Security personnel prevented a large group of Kenyans from crossing into Uganda allegedly to vote for Simon Mulongo, the NRM flag-bearer for Bubolo East. The group insisted they were Ugandans living in Kenya and eligible to vote.
Movement of forces: SECURITY has been beefed up along the Kenya-Uganda border ahead of Ugandas general elections scheduled for Friday.
On Sunday night [13 February], a man believed to be a member of the Ogaden National Liberation Front (ONLF) was shot dead by gunmen in Bula Iskedeg area of Garissa.

On Sunday night [13 February] in Garissa town where a Somali sheikh of Ethiopian origin was shot dead in a taxi. Unknown assailants killed Sheikh Hirsi Mohamed Dubed, 41, as he sat in a taxi at about 8p.m. [local time] and so far no arrest has been made. Reports suggest the OLF was responsible for the killing.
On Friday a demonstration was held in Voi town to protest against the government plan to settle IDPs on part of the land belonging to one of the major land owners in Taveta.
A General Service Unit officer has shot dead his boss before turning the gun on himself in Mombasa.

The public was on Wednesday treated to a dramatic car chase on the Nairobi-Nyeri highway after a police officer was abducted by a matatu crew. More than a dozen police cars full of armed officers raced along the highway moments after news broke that one of their colleagues had been kidnapped and was in a matatu.

In addition to an attack on a Somali sheikh in Garissa, two other scholars were killed in Mandera town and Dadaab. The provincial police chief said, 'It seems to be a trend targeting officials from Somalia, but we do not know the motive yet.'

In addition to an attack on a Somali sheikh in Garissa, two other scholars were killed in Mandera town and Dadaab. The provincial police chief said, 'It seems to be a trend targeting officials from Somalia, but we do not know the motive yet.'
A taxi driver has been shot dead in Migori Town. He was killed at a petrol station after surrendering the car keys to the gang of three at around 8.30pm on Saturday.
Residents of Mwatate, Voi and Wundanyi held demonstrations over the resettlement of IDPs in the region.
Residents of Mwatate, Voi and Wundanyi held demonstrations over the resettlement of IDPs in the region.

On February 4, Mr. Amos Wasonga Oguru, a salesman with a tyre company in Kisumu, was abducted from his Kamakowa home by four men posing as policemen at around 8 a.m. However, police who had been alerted by the victims wife intercepted the vehicle at Kibuye market and arrested a police officer and a taxi driver.

Alias Gamas, a member of a splinter ONLF group, was killed on 4 February inside the Dadaab refugee camp where he is said to have been hiding. He is alleged to have killed many people in Ethiopia and the attackers were pursuing him.

Ethnic violence erupted in Likia Location in Mau Naorkwhere the farmers and herders fought running battles the whole day. The violence erupted on Tuesday after a 70-year-old farmer, Mr. Kuria Wakaba, was hacked to death by herders from Likia location of Mau Narok Division.

Following the outbreak of violence in Likia, a group of herders at Tipis trading centre, about 20km away, attacked Mr Francis Thuo, poured petrol on him and set him on fire. He was rescued by transporters passing by.

In the afternoon of the 3rd of February, a group of herders attacked farmers at their shambas near Tipis trading centre as security forces patrolled Likia area. Four farmers were critically injured, but by the time of going to press, they had not been taken to hospital.

Violence erupted on Tuesday after a 70-year-old farmer, Mr. Kuria Wakaba, was hacked to death by herders Naork North District. Mr. Wakaba was killed in the controversial Witemere area in Likia forest. The same herders are said to have attacked Samuel Macharia on a farm in the same area

Movement of forces: More security personnel were on Tuesday rushed to Tana North District to help quell clashes between Orma and Wardei communities. Patrols had been intensified in the affected areas in a bid to restore peace.

One person died and two others were seriously injured after Pokot raiders attacked a village in Turkana South District. The Turkana herder died after he was shot by the attackers who made away with an unknown number of animals.
Security officers on the Kenya-Southern Sudan border are on high alert following an attack on a Turkana village by armed Toposa raiders who made away with more than 200 animals.

Mau Mau war veterans stormed the British High Commission earlier today demanding 105 trillion shillings from the former colonialist government as compensation for torture they underwent during the struggle for independence.

Six people were killed in a fresh wave of clashes between the Orma and Wardei communities in Tana North District. The dead included a four-year-old boy and four cattle rustlers who were killed shortly after driving away cattle from Bangale area.
In Nyanza Province, rustlers struck in two homes and stole four cows in Borabu.

A man was killed and 20 animals driven away by rustlers in Marakwet West on Monday. The gang armed with AK-47 rifles had attacked Kapterit Village and raided a homestead that had the most animals in the area. Villagers armed themselves and tracked down the rustlers in Kabolet Forest, where a fight took place.
A motorcyclist was on Saturday shot dead on the Hola-Waldena road between the border of Tana North and Tana River districts.

Two rival groups clashed on Wednesday during campaigns for the Kirinyaga Central Parliamentary seat. The commotion temporarily disrupted the Narc-Kenya rally at Kagumo town. A group alleged to be supporters of a rival party stormed the rally on motorcycles as the Narc-K leaders were addressing the crowd. However, the intruders were overpowered and thrown out of the rally as residents who stood at a distance cheered.

Two farmers were killed in a scramble to sell tobacco in Kuria West District. One of them was stabbed with a knife when he attempted to jump the queue. A mob then turned on the killer and beat him to death.

Policemen were on Wednesday caught on camera executing three men in cold blood on a busy Nairobi street. A motorist who happened upon the confrontation between plainclothes policemen and alleged criminals in the morning traffic pulled out his camera and took photographs. All the three men had already surrendered and were lying on the tarmac on Langata Road near Wilson Airport.

Families are fleeing their homes in Baringo East for fear of attacks in a conflict that has left two people dead. The chief of Kiserjan Location in Baringo Central said that two people had been killed and another one injured in the past two weeks.

Women in Muranga County on Tuesday held a peaceful protest march in support of 'Mututho Laws.' They petitioned the Government not to relent in its efforts to regulate beer access and consumption especially among the productive youths. Business came to a standstill as the women at one moment raided bars that were secretly selling beer and flushed out the patrons.

A Rwandese working for the World Bank was also shot at the gate of his residence in Mimosa Court on early Sunday. The official was confronted by armed thugs who robbed him of his valuables before shooting him on the thigh. They drove away with his Toyota Landcruiser.

Police on Sunday barred hundreds of people from attending a Republican Council rally at Tononoka grounds in Mombasa. A contingent of police officers in anti-riot gear sealed the grounds by 7am to lock out the group from the venue.

Unknown assailants ambushed a Nairobi top cop on Saturday night and shot him thrice before making away with his firearm. Shauri Moyo deputy OCS Inspector John Marete was shot on the neck and stomach in Nairobis Majengo area at around 9pm.

On Friday, January 14 at Ruaka, in Kiambu County, police officers attached to Gigiri Police Station sprayed a vehicle, KAW 058L with bullets killing one Gichuhi Njoroge and seriously injuring three others.
A British tourist and Kenyan companion were seized night in a carjacking ordeal on Mombasa Road, Nairobi. They were later helped to escape by villagers near the kidnappers den in Kiambu.

A Kenyan herder was on Friday killed in Somalia by members of the Islamist group Al Shabaab for refusing to part with his five camels as payment for a yearly tax. He is reported to have been shot on the head several times before his entire stock of camels was confiscated.

Police broke up an oath-taking ceremony on Saturday night and arrested 20 suspected followers of the proscribed Mungiki sect in Mwea East District. Weapons such as machetes and a spear were also seized from the suspects when police stormed Karira village of Kirinyaga County.
Protests disrupted learning in several schools in with parents locking out head teachers whose pupils performed dismally in last years KCPE examination.

Protests disrupted learning in several schools in Kakamega County with parents locking out head teachers whose pupils performed dismally in last years KCPE examination. In Mumias district, parents stormed Etenje Primary School and forced out the head teacher.

Protests disrupted learning in several schools in Kakamega County with parents locking out head teachers whose pupils performed dismally in last years KCPE examination. In Mumias district, parents stormed Etenje Primary School and forced out the head teacher.
Protests disrupted learning in several schools in with parents locking out head teachers whose pupils performed dismally in last years KCPE examination.
Villagers accuse security agencies of reign of terror. A man was attacked by security forces on New Years Day, accusing him of murdering a police officer.

Mystery surrounds the death of a prominent Machakos businessman after a post-mortem examination revealed a gun shot wound in the head. Mr Abed Makau Kikuyu, the proprietor of Tea Tot Hotels, was found dead at the Haile Selassie Road roundabout in Nairobi on the morning of December 31.

Hundreds of Kisumu youth took to the streets to protest the alleged involvement of Mombasa businessman Ali Punjani in drug trafficking Thursday. Led by Kisumu Youth Forum secretary general Joshua Omondi, they described Mr Punjani as a successful businessman both in Kenya and internationally, exonerating him from the illicit drug trade.

Refugees drawn from the Oromo community of Ethiopia but living in Nairobi yesterday took to the streets in a peaceful demonstration over what they termed harassment by the police. The refugees, mostly from Eastleigh and South C estates, say that they are being targeted unfairly.
A pro-new-Constitution group demonstration was forcibly dispersed by police who stopped their march to the ministry responsible for constitutional affairs.

On December 28, Turkana and Samburu raiders exchanged gunfire during the day in the town of Baragoi and a Samburu herdsman, 16-year-old Nkilei Lekupuny, was killed in the gun battle and his 43 sheep and goats taken.

On the evening of December 28 two mechanics boarded a matatu registration number KBK 334J plying the Nairobi route at Kahuro market. On reaching Ruiru, the matatu stopped and two people who claimed to be police officers arrested the two. The bodies of the arrested were found in Ruiru the next day with gunshot wounds, a few kilometers from where they had been arrested.

Chaos broke out at an anti-drugs demonstration in Kisauni, Mombasa on Monday. A 16-year-old pupil was among four protesters who were seriously injured when unknown people attacked the demonstrators. The protesters, waving placards and chanting slogans against substance abuse, were confronted by a gang of youths who reportedly pelted them with stones next to the Kisauni CDF offices.

Armed Maasai youths continued to keep vigil at the controversial 2,400-acre Rose Farm in Mau Narok to prevent government surveyors from sub-dividing it. A contingent of security personnel was sent on Saturday night to the disputed piece of land, raising fears of a clash with the armed youths. The youths armed with machetes, rungus, bows and arrows at one point barricaded the road leading to the farm in Tipis trading centre to block the police officers from accessing it.
An elderly woman was brutally murdered by an unknown gang in Gesabakwa Village in Borabu District.

A bomb exploded on a bus in central Nairobi Monday during a security search before it left for Kampala, killing three and wounding 23. An official with Kampala Coach Ltd said the would-be attacker was among those wounded or killed by the blast.

Two elderly civilians were driven from their home and hacked to death in Nyaguku Village in Manga District. It was suspected that the killings were executed by the outlawed sungu sungu group because the bodies bore deep panga cuts.

A Seventh Day Adventist pastor was killed by suspected sungu sungu gangsters in Nyamira County at the weekend. Neighbors said that the attackers, who allegedly posed as uniformed security officers, attacked the home at 8pm and killed Mr. Orina.

Police have shot dead five suspected carjackers in Ruiru, Nairobi after a dramatic car chase and recovered a firearm belonging to a senior police officer. The suspected thugs are reported to have hijacked a matatu but were intercepted by detectives from the Special Crime Prevention Unit (SCPU), who were trailing the gangsters from Githurai.
On 15 December, 15 people died in Kenyan Moyale and Marsabit districts after fierce fighting between the Ethiopian OLF and a splinter group in Badarero, Walda and Kate areas.
On 15 December, 15 people died in Kenyan Moyale and Marsabit districts after fierce fighting between the Ethiopian OLF and a splinter group in Badarero, Walda and Kate areas.
OLF fights with faction in northern Kenya, 15 killed in a location known as Badarero.

Mystery surrounds the shooting of a patron of a night club by a police officer inside a disco hall in Nyeri on Jamhuri Day. Mr. Walter Odhiambo was shot in the leg while scores of others were injured as police arrested revelers at a club in Mweiga Township.

Kenyan security forces engaged in a battle with OLF rebels. Several were captured and at least one rebel operative sustained injuries from a shooting. The injured man was later captured by Ethiopian security personnel.
Movement of forces: Special security teams have been deployed to western Kenya to trace the SLDF gangs which have threatened to re-ignite violence in the area.

Nine people were killed when Pokot raiders attacked a village in Turkana South and stole more than 600 goats. Among the dead are two Kenya Police reservists and a herder who were shot by the raiders at Kepelkok, Kainuk Division. Six of the raiders were, however, shot dead while others escaped with bullet wounds.

Nine people were killed when Pokot raiders attacked a village in Turkana South and stole more than 600 goats. Among the dead are two Kenya Police reservists and a herder who were shot by the raiders at Kepelkok, Kainuk Division. Six of the raiders were, however, shot dead while others escaped with bullet wounds.
A brother to Regional Development minister Fred Gumo is recovering in a Mombasa hospital after he was shot at the weekend.

Two Kenyan police officers were shot dead Friday in the Kenyan capital while on traffic duty. The officers were on duty on the highway, when two men on a motorbike attacked and shot two of them dead. The attackers were pursued after the incident and the two of them were shot dead.

A manager of a farm in belonging to the family of late Mbiyu Koinange was shot dead by a gunman near Nakuru town. Mr. Moses ole Mpoe, the manager of Muthera farm in Mau Narok division of Nakuru Country, died on the spot together with his passenger after a gunman riding in a motorcycle fired about 10 bullets at their vehicle.
An off-duty Kenyan police officer was killed in a targeted grenade attack in a suburb of Nairobi.

Five people are expected in court on Wednesday to answer charges of killing Mau Narok land activist Moses ole Mpoe. Mr Mpoes car was sprayed with bullets at the Nakuru-Njoro turn-off last Friday. A passenger in the car also died while Mr Mpoes brother is being treated for gunshot wounds.
Pokot raiders attacked Napeitom Village in Turkana East; loots; takes livestock .
A herder was killed on Thursday in Lotongot Village when Pokot raiders attacked the area.

Supporters of a civic candidate in the last General Election held a demonstration to protest at the delay in determining a petition she had filed. The supporters left the Eldoret High Court immediately after it had allowed the current councilor to file an appeal after a magistrates court had declared that he lost the election. They marched through the streets to Nandi Gardens where they held a noisy protest.

A fight broke out at a Mombasa mosque over a preacher suspected to be behind the recruitment of local youths to the [Somali hard-line Islamist] Al-Shabab militia group. The tussle started after the evening prayers on Tuesday when some faithful tried to block the preacher from delivering a sermon. But another group insisted that the imam should preach. Arguments outside the mosque degenerated into an all-out fight between the two groups.

Two secondary school students from Mombasa are among six youths intercepted in Lamu while being ferried to Somalia to join a terror group. Security forces laid ambush in Kizingitini and arrested six while in transit to Somalia.
Two protest marches took place in the capital (one consisting of women's groups and the other of youth groups) in support of arrested Narc Kenya MP Gideon Mbuvi Kioko.

An operation to arrest Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) militants hiding in the country has paid dividend. Hundreds of joint security forces drawn from the army, GSU [paramilitary General Service Unit], regular and Administration Police conducted the operation in Moyale, Wajir North and North Horr for two weeks. Eastern provincial police officer Marcus Ochola said Kenyan security officers arrested at least 25 of the fighters, adding they were being held at different custodial facilities.

An operation to arrest Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) militants hiding in the country has paid dividend. Hundreds of joint security forces drawn from the army, GSU [paramilitary General Service Unit], regular and Administration Police conducted the operation in Moyale, Wajir North and North Horr for two weeks. Eastern provincial police officer Marcus Ochola said Kenyan security officers arrested at least 25 of the fighters, adding they were being held at different custodial facilities.

An operation to arrest Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) militants hiding in the country has paid dividend. Hundreds of joint security forces drawn from the army, GSU [paramilitary General Service Unit], regular and Administration Police conducted the operation in Moyale, Wajir North and North Horr for two weeks. Eastern provincial police officer Marcus Ochola said Kenyan security officers arrested at least 25 of the fighters, adding they were being held at different custodial facilities.
4 fishermen killed on Lake Turkana by Ethiopian militia

Four Kenyan fishermen have been killed by suspected Ethiopian militia in Todonyang, along the shores of Lake Turkana [northwestern Kenya]. The fishermen were killed by Merrile tribesmen while fishing on Monday morning [15 November].
Recruitment: Barely a week after the government listed the separatist Mombasa Republican Council as illegal, the defiant group has gone public about its massive recruitment of youth.
Over 200 traders at the famous chicken market in Nairobis Maziwa area demonstrated against its demolition condemning the act and calling for immediate action.

The Kenyan navy shot dead three suspected Somali pirates who had attacked a naval patrol off the coastal town of Kilifi. Naval spokesman Ongeri said the attack took place well inside Kenyan waters, off the town of Kilifi, which is located some 60 kilometers (40 miles) north of the countries main port of Mombasa.

Police have repulsed angry demonstrators who had barricaded the Nairobi-Mombasa highway for more than 24 hours demanding the immediate repair of the dilapidated Voi-Taveta road. Police came in four lorries at 4 a.m. and engaged the rowdy youth by firing tear gas before opening the road for motorists.
Hundreds of Voi residents on Tuesday took to the streets and barricaded the Mombasa highway to protest against the poor state of roads in Taita Taveta County.

Matatu operators demonstrated on Monday against the poor quality of roads on the Voi-Taveta and Voi-Wundanyi-Mgange routes. Police tried to open the roads, but as demonstrators were joined by residents, they retreated.

A police officer in a rage shot dead 10 people in a rampage through two bars in central Kenya early Sunday before giving himself up for arrest. The officer shot and killed two of his own colleagues in a bar in the central town of Siakago, before running

A police officer in a rage shot dead 10 people in a rampage through two bars in central Kenya early Sunday before giving himself up for arrest. The officer shot and killed two of his own colleagues in a bar in the central town of Siakago, before running amok in another bar nearby, killing eight civilians.
Policeman killed after ambush by OLA rebels in northern Kenya

A police officer was shot dead and two others seriously injured by Oromo Liberation Front rebels during an operation to flush out the Ethiopian rebels from northern Kenya. The officers drove into a trap laid by the rebels at a remote location on the borders between Sololo and Wajir North districts.A fire exchange ensued between the two forces before the officer was felled.
Farmers protest against slow justice over illegal sale of land in Ikolomani.
Business came to a standstill at the Wakulima Market in Nairobi yesterday after traders took to the streets, protesting against new charges introduced by the city council last week.

Eight Ugandans were arrested by the police officers on Wednesday for allegedly fishing on Tanzanian waters. But the Ugandan fishermen decided to lay an ambush for the officers. When the officers saw a strange boat on their waters, they approached but were surrounded by the fishermen. A brief scuffle ensued but the officers lost the battle.

Panic gripped Karatina when suspected Mungiki adherents nearly clashed with a vigilante group. But police intervention averted a seemingly bloody confrontation between the two groups that have had frosty relationship since last year when their battles led to loss of life.

Movement of forces: Security forces have been deployed along the Kenya-Ethiopia border to flush out militias fighting the Ethiopian government. Eastern provincial police boss Marcus Ochola, who heads the operation, said the team will flush out the agents of Oromo Liberation Front [OLF].

A Greek-owned tanker with a German skipper and a crew of 16 has been seized by pirates off the coast of Kenya. It was attacked around 50 nautical miles east from the Kenyan port of Mombasa and initially drifted before moving at around 10 knots from Sunday morning.

More than 400 families are up in arms after a government agency ordered them to move out of a 20-acre land parcel in Tana Delta District. The last attempt to evict the group was bloody with dozens of people, including police officers sustaining serious injuries.

A statement from the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) said it received a report that a Singapore-registered Liquefied Petroleum Gas vessel, York, was boarded by suspected pirates at about 90 nautical miles from Mombasa, Kenya.

Police on Sunday began investigations into circumstances that led to the death of fans at the Nyayo National Stadium during a floodlit Premier League match. Over 380 police officers including a 100 man anti riot police contingent had been deployed to Nyayo National Stadium to provide security during the tension packed match. Four bodies including that of a 21-year old Railways Training Institute student were being preserved at the City Mortuary by Sunday afternoon. Another person who died in the stampede has been identified as a Kenyatta National Hospital based taxi driver.

Thirty people are reported to have been killed in the Thursday [21 October] night clashes between Al Shabaab and a pro-government Somali militia on the Kenya-Somali border, with two Kenyans slightly injured in the clashes.

Striking tea workers started a protest over the looming lay-offs following the mechanization of tea picking. At the same time security has been intensified in the area. Security personnel have been deployed to patrol the affected tea estates to help maintain law and order.
OLF attack village in north of Kenya, kidnap 3 they accuse of spying for Ethiopian government
The vessel FV Golden Wave was captured by suspected Somali pirates off the coast of Lamu, with 46 Kenyan staff on board who were then held captive.
Two people have been killed after Kenyan security forces opened fire at vehicle carrying Somalis near the border with Somalia.
Rioters block Mombasa-Nairobi road at Samburu in protest of increased accidents on the road.
Protests for the right to health and affordable AIDS drugs.
Youths protest the arrest of suspected murderers. Police shoot at crowd, seriously injuring two.
Suspected Toposa militia from Sudan attack Nanan in Turkana West. One woman seriously injured.
Pokot militia kill 3 in Turkana.
The leaders of Supkem and others have said that nine Kenyan human rights activists are being held illegally in Uganda without regard to Kenyan laws. Many gather to protest.
Rioters blocked highway in Miritini protesting increase in road accidents.
tea farmers riot on Kimunye-Kamugunda road, demanding better pay.
Students riot and pelt stones at parents, protesting the closure of the school over an administration dispute.
Tea farmers boycott over payment at Thumaita tea company in Kirinyaga East and at Mununga tea factory in Kirinyaga Central.
50 youths invade a hotel and assault an employee, rioting against the ownership.
Muslim clerics in Mombasa protest the arrest of a radio show host.

Rioters protested against forced eviction set fire to vehicles, blocked roads, threw petrol bombs, and threw stones at police, injuring two policemen. Initial reports of 2 people killed, later reports of one person killed, 11 injured with gunshot wounds.
A man who killed his wife and kids was seized by a mob and killed in Migori.
Construction workers at the Kirima property protest in demand of payment.
Women protest inadequate health budget.
Pokot militia attack 26 villages in Turkana County. 7 killed.
Sudanese protesters push for referendum to be held in January as scheduled.
Cattle raiders kill a watchman in Sotik-Borabu area.
Unknown group kill woman with an axe, her daughter was raped.
Protests against alleged land grabbing.
Protests against increased crime in Kakamega.
Cattle raiders kill a civilian at Kawaa school in Machakos.
Vigilante militia stone to death two matatu drivers that attempted to rob passengers.
Five killed in a tribal clash over land. Specifics of location unknown.
Protests in Voi over increased insecurity.
A group of people from Chwele Market hurled stones at a helicopter carrying Wildlife Minister Noah Wekesa, Saboti MP Eugene Wamalwa and former Kimilili MP Mukisa Kituyi. Three people hurt.
Al-Shabab members clash with police and security forces at a Kenya-Somalia border town.
400 merchants gather in a Nairobi slum to protest the demolition of their market stands. Police intervene in the demonstration, killing one.
Protests in July against increased crime in Kakamega.
Arrests: Kenyan police arrest dozens men believed to be in connection with the recent Ugandan bombing in the city of Kampala.
Movement of forces: The Kenyan Government deployed more forces to the Somali border and closed traffic between Mandera and Beled Hawo district.
An armed group attacks a church, kills two parishioners.
A large group of protesters march in Nairobi to denounce plans by members of parliament to increase their own salaries.
Matatu drivers protests raise in parking fees.
Matatu drivers protests raise in parking fees.
2 killed and several inured by unknown group using panga knives.
Suspected Turkana kill 3 and injure 4 in cattle raid in Nachola.
Stone throwing youths threw stones to protest the killing of slum-dwellers by police. Police forces dispersed the crowd with tear gas.
Prison warders boycott work for second day after their colleagues were killed by police on June 16.

actor1: Police Forces of Kenya (2002-2013) Prison Guards
notes: A group of prison wardens ambush police on Maai Mahiu-Naivasha road leading to 2 deaths. Police persue the warders to Ruaka. In Ruaka, police killed 4. 2 civilians killed in crossfire.
Prison warders boycott work after their colleagues were killed by police earier in the day.

actor2: Police Forces of Kenya (2002-2013) Prison Guards
notes: Escaping prisoners and police clashes in Nyeri at Kingongoo prison. Several injured.
Students find an unexploded bomb in Isiolo.
8 fishermen abducted by pirates, rescued on June 18.
Six killed and 109 injured when a group of people lob two stolen Kenyan Army grenades into a church rally against proposed constitutional reforms, held in Nairobis Uhuru Park.
A British man is attacked in his home in a Nairobi suburb, resulting in the victim losing his fingers by machete.
Youth beat two journalists in Eldoret.
ODM protest at an opposition rally, gathering where a PDP helicopter was trying to land.
Property destruction: Unknown group burn down homes in Ngorano.
2 police seriously injured in clashes with spear-wielding herders in Samburu.
ODM protesters against the delay of party nominations.
A son of a former cabinet minister critically injured in attack on Mau Narok farm.
Sugar farmers protest against the appointment of new chair of Nzoia Sugar Company.
Matheniko raid Turkana cattle, sparking a battle
Al Shabaab attacked a Kenyan border town Dadaj-Bula, opened fire on the residents, wounding seven of them.
Two telecommunication technicians are shot dead by a group that was vandalizing their equipment.
A Saudi Arabian diplomat was attacked and severely injured when he was attacked by gangsters. It is unknown if this action is politically motivated.
Two police reservists are killed when armed men attack them.
Two Rift Valley clans clash of a land dispute, police intervene.
A gang of three men shot and killed a businessman in his home, leaving without taking anything.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab raids a desolate Kenyan border town, attack two hotels causing property damage, but no causalities.
A group of armed cattle thrives attack and kill a voter registration clerk.
A Muslim human rights group protests the deportation of suspected Islamic militants from Kenya.
Relatives of 10 Kenyans being held by pirates protest over the lack of governmental intervention to free them. Police disperse the crowd.
Violent clashes breakout in suburban Nairobi in protest of the previous nights raid on Mungiki sect members.
Police shoot and kill seven Mungiki sect members during a raid following an attack on motorcycle enthusiasts.
Armed robbers kill three, including a 14-year-old student.
Thousands of teachers who retired between the years of 1997 and 2007 protest to the lack of retirement benefits they were promised by a high court two years ago.
A group of armed men descended on a Rift Valley town and steal 3,000 of the residents livestock.
Ethiopian tribesmen cross the border into Kenya, battle police, kill one, abduct five others.
A group marches in protest of corrupt ministers, asking President Kibaki to relieve them from their positions,

'1 guard for an INGO was hospitalised after being hacked with machetes by a gang of thieves when they attacked the organisation's office at night during a black out. They demanded to be shown where the motorbikes were, and attacked the guard when they could not find them immediately.'

'1 INGO international staff (Canadian) kidnapped after dropping off their child at school. Victim held for ransom and later resuced on 20 Feb. by police in a undercover operation.'

Protesters took to the streets accusing Prime Minister Raila Odinga of waging a vendetta of two cabinet members whom they support.
6 Kenyan soldiers injured.

A mob attacks and successfully stops a same-sex wedding from taking place.
A group of Christian churches protest against the possibility of adding certain Islamic laws to the new draft of the Kenyan constitution.
A Red Cross volunteer was shot dead by police as he was assisting victims following a road accident.
A woman is shot and killed by a violent gang after she is robbed.
Five killed in a tribal clash along a regional border.
An Ethiopia militia kill three Kenyan fishermen near Lake Turkana that creates a border between the two countries.

Hundreds of Sudanese demonstrate to press for peace in Sudan.
Protests against bus fare increases.
Pirates attack and injure 14 fishermen in Got Rateng.
Muslim rioters attempted to eject US Marines from a Garissa hotel, pelted people with stones and toched US flags, and mounted roadblocks. Riot police arrived. 40 injured.
5,000 traders marched in protest of Mungiki raid on Wakulima market earlier in the day.
Mungiki militia raided Wakulima market, injuring traders.
Disabled hawkers blocked entrances to Jongoo House, Nairobi, demanding to see the VP over alleged harasment by security guards.
Woman prisoner raped and beat in cell.
Anti-US Marines protests by pastoralist that claim animals vaccinated by Marines died after treatment.
3,700 council workers on strike demanding November salaries. Cargo clearing agents also protested in Mombasa, protesting against bribery and shortage of staff.
Agreement: FNL and Burundi military enter peace talks in Nairobi.
Protesters allege government cover up of murder of university worker.
Protests in Siaya against decision to suspend Yala River basin project.
Protests in Bondo against decision to suspend Yala River basin project.
Protests against the removal of East African Portland Cement managing director.
Youth petrol-bombed a Metro shuttle bus on Jogoo road. One passenger injured.
Rioters involved in taxi strike blocked roads, lit bonfires and beat up motorists driving along Kilgoris-Kisii road.
38,000 minibus taxi drivers in Kenya went on strike to protest against tough transport laws issued by the government. In Kangemi, Rioters threw stones at cars. Police fired tear gas.
Following riots earlier in the day, NARC supporters demonstrated, carrying twigs and signs denouncing Korir (KANU).
MP Joseph Korir (KANU) supporters riot against NARC supporters. Police intervened.
Pro-Okemo (KANU) demonstrations.
Pro-Okemo (KANU) demonstrations.
Pro-Okemo (KANU) demonstrations.
Vigilante militia attack suspected robbers with sticks and crude weapons. 2 killed, 2 injured.
Pro-Okemo (KANU) demonstrations.
Kenya Knit Garments Ltd workers went on strike demanding to be allowed to join a union. Rioters threw things at passing cars and police. Police fired tear gas.
Wamalwa (RPK) supporters protest his partliamentary election defeat. One protester beaten and injured by NARC opposition supporters. No reports of serious injuries.
Defusal: Unexploded bomb found in Mikaru district in Nyandarua District.
Students and staff of Utalii College boycotted classes in protest at appaointment of new principal.
Gunmen attack MP in his home in Nairobi.
Gigiri residents protest over grabbing of land by private developers.
Protests demanding the revocation of grabbed land that was allocated to government officials. Priest arrested and beat by police, suffered chest and arm injuries.
100 supporters of defeated parliamentary nominee Wamalwa (RPK) demonstrate in Kitale, calling for nullification of results.
Vigilante militia lynch 6 suspected murderers in Matharite, Gatara and Kabanya (Gitiri) villages, all in Kiharu District.
Nairobi City Council employees protest lack of pay.
Unknown group from Ethiopia dressed in military uniforms attacked Anan village in Moyale, killing 3.

Government-sponsored students at Kenyas Moi University clashed with other students whom they said were being favoured by the college leadership - police intervened to disperese the rioters, the university was closed.

assoc_actor_2: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya; Police Forces of Kenya (2002-2013)
notes: Assistant national treasurer and member of Ford Asili Party shot at Masurura Farm in Kuria (capital = Kihancha). Police deployed to the area.

assoc_actor_2: FORD-Asili: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Asili
notes: A Ford-Asili official is shot by suspected cattle rustlers at the controversial Masurura Farm in Migori county. The official survived the attack.
Truck drivers protest the arrest of colleagues.
Students destroy school property and burned dorms in protest of the decision to suspend video shows and discos. Several arrested.
Rioters destroyed a fence and raided forest land set aside for the construction of a memorial near Keiyo.
A delegate from the ongoing peace talks, an MP and a businessman were found shot dead at the outskirts of Nairobi.

Students destroy computers, lab equipment and windows at school, in protest of students being suspended the prior week. Police fire tear gas and bullets in the air. Students pelted police with stones.
Students destroy school property in Kiini.
Students destroy school property in Kirinyaga.
Tea farmers in Kisii demonstrate against an order to take part in the election of new Kenya Tea Development Agency directors.
Former street children demonstrate demanding to be taken to the National Youth Service College.
Farmers protest a deduction in bonuses.
8 injured in clashes between Galwina and Bana clans from Somalia in Eldoret. Police deployed, 14 arrested.
Anti-torture protests.
Students burn down a dormitory in Taita Taveta district (coordinates of capital Mwatate used), in protest of the hiring policies of the school.
Church members protested against the transfer of ministers.

Mungiki sect members joined a Mau Mau protest rally and called for the lifitng of a ban on the Mungiki group. Police fired shots in the air to disperse the crowd and beat protesters with sticks, Mungiki rioters threw stones at the police. 20 rioters injured. One shot. and injured. 20 arrested.
50 MPs walk out of parliament in protest over the rejected motion to discuss harassment of journalists.
500 students at Chinga high school in Othaya rioted and destroyed windows at school, protesting lack of entertainment on weekends.
100 students at Mugunda secondary in Kieni broke school gates to protesting the arrest of their driver.
Clashes between Galwina and Bana clans from Somalia in Eldoret. 8 arrested.

The public viewing of the body of constitutional review official Odhiambo Mbai turned chaotic as youths rioted, stoning police and blocking roads in Kisumu Town. Police intervened to disperse the crowds. Several people were injured.

Toposa cattle rustlers from southern Sudan raided a Turkana border village - 18 were killed in total in the clash which ensued. Ca. 1,000 animals were stolen. LOCATION: Nakareso Village three kilometres North of Lokichoggio town.
Students rioted against the killing of senior Constitutional Committee member Odhiambo Mai. Police intervened to disperse the crowds.
Students rioted against the killing of senior Constitutional Committee member Odhiambo Mai. Police intervened to disperse the crowds.

Odhiambo Mbai, a senior official in Kenyas constitutional review conference was shot dead by three men assumed to be hired gunmen - nothing was leading leading to the conclusion that the attack was politically motivated.

Merille cattle raiders from Omorate in southern Ethiopia invaded Narakipus manyatta(Turkana homestead) where they shot dead 2. Ca. 240 animals were stolen. LOCATION: Natet area, Lokitaung sub-district.
Toposa raiders from Natapal, southern Sudan, attacked a manyatta near Lokichoggio town in Turkana District. Ca. 300 cattle stolen. Police intervened shooting 3 raiders dead
Toposa raiders from Natapal, southern Sudan, attacked a manyatta near Lokichoggio town in Turkana District. Ca. 300 cattle stolen. (police intervened shooting 3 raiders dead - coded separately)

During second round of the National Constitutional Conference. Youth rioted in respnse to the creation of the post of executive Prime Minister. They demanded that senior cabinet minister Raila Odinga be appointed Prime Minister once the constitutional co

Raid by Karamajong raiders on Pokot herders. 100s of animals stolen. 9 killed in the battle which ensued. LOCATION: UGANDA - 40km from the Kenyan border at West Pokot District (district capital = Kapenguria)

Farmers protested against the failure of the Kenyan Wildlife Services to contain elephants in the area - police intervened firing live rounds - 1 girl was killed by cross fire which went through the kiosk in which she was working.
Suspected al-Qaeda member from Yemen arrested in Mombasa - he then detonated a grenade that injured himself and 2 police officers.
Muslims protest against proposed anti-terrorism bill, saying it targets Muslims.
Traders demonstrate to protest against transfer of British soldiers.
Students riot and destroy school property with stones, complaining of harsh punishment by deputy headmaster.
Students riot and destroy school property with stones, complaining of harsh punishment by deputy headmaster.
Student riot by destroying school property.

assoc_actor_2: Private Security Forces (Kenya); Police Forces of Kenya (2002-2013)
notes: Rioters destroyed fences and raided a farm in Kiplombe. 5 watchmen injured and taken to the hospital. Rioters threw stones at police when they arrived.
Workers at Eldoret airport staged a demonstration against the ban on cargo flights.
Landlords in Eldoret demonstrate against farmers attempts to claim plots.
2 policemen and 4 others killed, and 1 policeman wounded, in an ambush in Manyatta near Lokitaung.
Unknown gunmen kill The Nation journalist outside of his home in Nairobi, shot and injured the house watchman. Gunmen did not take any possessions.
5 Turkana fishermen were attacked and killed by suspected Murle militia from Ethiopia.
3 people were shot dead by Pokot raiders during a cattle raid at Lokori. 100s of animals were stolen but later recovered by security personnel.
200 residents of Kimoriot village in Baringo held a demonstration in support of the MP who was barred from entering Muchongoi.
Kakamega residents and members of the Angican Church of Kenya protest increased insecurity.

Eight people, among them six police officers and the Makutano-Sololo sub-chief were seriously injured in an attack organized by unknown people.The attackers armed with hand grenades and heavy machine-guns destroyed a dispensary at the Dambala Fachana area.
Kiambu residents protested Commission of Inquirys decision to conduct meetings in private.

source: The New Humanitarian; Kenya Broadcasting Corporation
notes: Police officer and his driver killed by a landmine in Marsabit. 8 officers and 2 civilians seriously injured.
2 chief administrators in Kisii hacked to death and shot in their homes.
Rioters set fire to houses of a suspected hit squad that killed 2 chiefs earlier in the day, and rioters severely beat a teacher. Police deployed. Several arrested.
500 protesters demonstrated in Suneka town, Kisii, condemning the killing of two local chiefs.
Agreement: Peace talks begin between Sudanese military and SPLA/M in Nakuru.
Vigilante militia lynch 7 suspected criminals in Kisii.

1 Council clerk was attacked by about 300 Nyeri Council workers. The drama in Nyeri unfolded over the issue of the transfer of Chief Officers, which has rocked the local council and is also threatening to explode into a major confrontation in the Nairobi
Somali women delegates to peace talks in Nairobi demonstrate, calling for a conclusion to the peace process.
Students at Maseno University rioted in protest of the sacking of their vice-chancellor, Prof Fredrick Onyango. Police intervened leading to a clash in which 2 students were killed (coded separately)

1 Sudanese refugess were killed by Turkana locals in clashes tied to cattle raiding incidents. (Total = 4 since Friday, 20/6/03)
2 more Sudanese refugees dies plus 3 Turkana locals in clashes tied to cattle raiding incidents. (Total = 10 since Friday, 20/6/03)
1 Ethiopian refugee killed by Turkana locals in clashes between the two groups relating to cattle raiding incidents.

About 300 cattle raiders suspected to be from West Pokot District invaded manyattas in Lokori and drove away 950 cattle, 500 camels and 200 sheep and goats. Police intervened killing 2 (coded separately)

Suspected Turkana bandits raided a village in Baringo East constituency - 3 killed, ca. 180 animals stolen
Turkana raiders attacked a village in Sigor division of West Pokot District. 3 killed - FATALITIES NOT ACTOR SPECIFIC, ca. 100 cattle stolen.

2 Ugandan cattle raiders were gunned down by police in a battle which followed their raid on a farm belonging to Sigor MP Philip Rotinos father in Trans Nzoia District. There were about 30 raiders in total.
1 unarmed man was shot dead by police who suspected him to be a criminal.

Students rioted over a decision to send home all nursing students after the students had boycotted the university in an attempt to secure higher loans and paid internships. Property was damaged, police intervened - led to clash between police and rioters

Religious tension between Christians and Muslims - disagreement over the inclusion of specialist Kadhi courts in the new draft constitution. Muslims marched in protest of the opposition from Christian groups
Rice farmers protest exploitation by the national irrigation board.
Armed Dassanach (Merille) tribe from Ethiopia attacked Turkana fishermen, shooting dead 2, injuring 2 in Todenyang, Lokitaung Sub District, Turkana.
Pokot cattle raiders on Saturday attacked a Turkana grazing field at Loya, in Lorengippi, and stole 10 camels.
Toposa raiders from Southern Sudan attacked Turkana herdsmen killed two and drove away 100 cows.
Toposa tribe raided Turkana village killing two - Led to revenge attack by Turkana militia on Toposa villagers, several were injured, animals were stolen. LOCATION: unspecified location near Oropoi
Toposa raiders from Southern Sudan attacked Turkana herdsmen killed 2 (coded separately) and drove away 100 cows. Led to battle - Turkana   police vs. Toposa. 4 Toposa were killed.

3 were killed during attack on a vehicle owned by former Isiolo North MP Charfano Guyo Mokku by unidentified armed bandits (coded separately) . 2 policemen were also killed - it is assumed that they responded to the attack leading to a battle between the

3 were killed during attack on a vehicle owned by former Isiolo North MP Charfano Guyo Mokku by unidentified armed bandits . (2 policemen were also killed - coded separately) LOCATION: Unspecified part of either Isiolo or Samburu District
Police reservist shot and killed a church pastor outside his home in Fuata Nyayo Estate, Nairobi.
Two rival groups clash in church over leadership dispute of Legio Maria church - 1 killed in the incident
A police officer went on an unexplained rampage at his own station killing 1 other police officer and 2 civilians who had come in to report a crime.
An off-duty police officer was shot dead - some reported that the officers had mistaken him for a gangster/ others claim that members of the public perpetrated the attack.
Students protested against poor conditions at Mombasa Polytechnic University (lack of water supply and proper sanitation)- led to riots - police intervened.
Students protested against poor conditions at Mombasa Polytechnic University (lack of water supply and proper sanitation)- led to riots - police intervened.

Students demanded that members of staff resigned over suspected corruption - police intervened shooting 3 students as they refused to leave the university - led to battle between protesters who retaliated and police.
First peaceful student sit-in protest - students demanded that members of staff resigned over suspected corruption - police intervened shooting 3 students as they refused to leave the university.
Ca. 300 residents yesterday protested in Engachura estate, Nakuru against increased insecurity in the area. They feared attacks from Mungiki sect in particular.
Rioters set fire to a farm.
An army officer shot dead an assistant Molo chief in an unknown dispute.

Arson attack on farm belonging to MP Nicholas Biwott attack by ca. 500 unidentified armed youths. The attack was suspected to be politically motivated and linked to land dispute. LOCATION: Kipkuis area of Eldoret North Constituency, Uasin Gishu District
Police shoot dead one Mungiki member in retaliation who was suspected to be involved in the recent attacks in the area many more were arrested. Linked to disputed control of Matatu routes.

Mungiki member went on a rampage injuring several people in the city. The body of a second officer was found - assumed to be killed by Mungiki (previous killing coded separately). Linked to disputes over control of matatu routes.
Mungiki member went on a rampage injuring several people in the city. Linked to disputes over control of matatu routes.
Mungiki member went on a rampage injuring several people in the city. A poliec officer who intervened was killed. Linked to disputes over control of matatu routes.
Mungiki member went on a rampage injuring several people in the city. Police who intervened killed 2 Mungiki and 1 police officer killed. Linked to disputes over control of matatu routes.

Students from Kenyatta University riot against Union representative disputes - the group was violent damaging property and injuring several people including journalists who were trying to cover the event.

Armed Pokot raiders attacked Nakwamoru in Turkana District and surrounded the villagers before spraying them with bullets killing the woman and injuring another person in another Molo District attack.
Seven Turkanas have been killed by armed Pokot raiders along the common border since the beginning of the year. DETAILS NOT SPECIFIED. LOCATION: Turkana District (district capital = Lodwar)
Unidentified rival youths battled in Mathare slum, Nairobi. Houses were burned. 1 civilian killed in the attacks - likely to include involvement by Mungiki members from Pangani Estate, Nairobi.

1 killed, houses burned, animals stolen - battle ensued between residents and cattle raiders - part of a series of attacks in the Molo District. Linked to ethnic rivalry but actors not specified in the reports. ACTORS NOT SPECIFIED.

Clashes between rioters from rival taxi driver teams. 20 passengers injured when rioters blocked the highway in Kirinyaga along Nyeri-Nairobi highway, and pelted cars with stones and broke windows. No reports of serious injuries. Police fired bullets in the air and used tear gas.
Members of the recently outlawed Mungiki sect on Saturday afternoon hacked to death two men they suspected were policemen.
Mungiki members riot in Nairobi in response to alleged police harassment
On 7 January 2003, locals marched and attacked the police in Embakasi (Embakasi East, Nairobi) in reaction to the killing of an off-duty Air Force nurse sergeant by the police. [size=no report]
Off-duty police chief was shot dead outside of his home by suspected Mungiki members.

Armed gangsters raided Cotts Tours and Travel Agency belonging to the immediate former Vice-President, Musalia Mudavadi - nothing was stolen suggesting that the attack may have been politically motivated.
Mungiki attacked matatu (bus) drivers killing 1 - it can be assumed to be linked to the series of violence in Nakuru regarding disputed control of matatu routes.

Mungiki attacked matatu (bus) drivers killing 1 - it can be assumed to be linked to the series of violence in Nakuru regarding disputed control of matatu routes. 1 other was later reported to be killed by Mungiki in the area.
Rioters burn down a building in an attempt to flush out a police officer turned his gun on an innocent women during a pursuit of another man shooting her dead in Huruma estate, Nairobi.
A police officer turned his gun on an innocent women during a pursuit of another man shooting her dead in Huruma estate, Nairobi. Led to riots in protest of the killing.
Fighting continued between Mungiki and armed matatu (bus) touts clash in a dispute over control of bus routes.

Mungiki and armed matatu (bus) touts clash in a dispute over control of bus routes. Homes were attacked and property burned. - 7 killed by Mungiki (Death total total:9 Minus 2 coded for the previous day   3 who died later from their injuries). FATALITIES
Mungiki and armed matatu (bus) touts clash in a dispute over control of bus routes. Police responded killing 1 Mungiki member. (Death toll total: 4 - Minus 1 recorded in previous day)
Mungiki and armed matatu (bus) touts clash in a dispute over control of bus routes in Lake Nakuru National Park. Police responded killing 1 Mungiki member.

Four workers of an international aid organisation were held hostage for six hours by an armed Pokot herdsman for causing his camels to leave a grazing field. LOCATION: Unspecified area in Turkana District (district capital = Lodwar)
Mungiki and armed matatu (bus) touts clash in a dispute over control of bus routes. Homes were attacked and property burned. - 2 touts killed by Mungiki at Lake View Estate, Nakuru
Mungiki and armed matatu (bus) touts clash in a dispute over control of bus routes. 2 Mungiki youths were admitted to hospital with injuries after attack by touts.
