Police fired tear gas to disperse nurses demonstration in Nairobi.

1000 Kenyatta National Hospital nurses go on strike for higher salaries. Barricaded the gates of Afya health house. Nurses in Embu, Kisii, Kisumu, Meru, Nakuru and Nyeri also went on strike for higher salaries on the same day.
10 taken to hospital after fighting between rioters at voting centers in Mombasa.
One man stabbed to death in Kakamega in fight between rival KANU supporters.
Rioters stoned the car of local government minister in Kapenguria.
KANU supporters in Siaya injure a man they accused of hoarding civic nomination papers.
Unknown man slashed a man with a panga during a rally of former Kenyan envoy to Saudi Arabia.
Youths throw petrol bombs at Moi Avenue Primary School before KANU party elections. No injuries reported.
6 KANU supporters attacked and seriously injured in their homes by youth with whips, clubs and simis.
Rioters attack a convoy of cabinet minister Nyiva Mwendwa during a campaign trail in Kitui, then beat a Mwendwa supporter. One man critically injured.
Rioters threw stones at a convoy of KANU member Nyenze in Kanyangi area.
Youth throw a petrol bomb at the car of KANU parlimentary candidate in Kakamega. No injures.
NDP presidential candidate Odinga injured when rioters stoned his motorcade in Kilgoris. Odinga sustained cuts on his face, his bodygiard was taken to the hospital in serious condition.
Clashes between Kisii and Maasaii in Nyangusu. Kisii militia use bow and arrows in retaliation for clashes earlier in the day in Kilgoris. 2 killed, others seriosuly injured.

Clashes between Kisii and Maasai tribes after policeman killed a Maasaii man earlier in the day. Maasai tribesmen use machetes and knives, killing 10. Another 2 Kisii were killed later in the day at Olemtongit Hill in Trans Mara District (coordinates unavailable, Trans Mara capital Kilgoris used).
Women protest, calling for the release of Maasai members arrested in clashes between Maasai and Kisii militia. Police used tear gas.
Policeman kills a member of the Maasai tribe.
Police shoot and kill five suspected gangsters in a district south of Mombasa.
Farmers riot for second day against the importation of wheat and wheat prices. They blocked roads with tractors, cars and stones.
Five killed in a land battle between opposing tribes. 6
Farmers riot against the importation of wheat. They blocked roads with tractors, cars and stones.
Bandits kill three at Hagardera refugee camp in the northeast (Garissa District).
Agreement: Peace talks begin between SPLA/M and Government of Sudan.
A politician from the National Development Party was shot and killed during a gun battle between coffee smugglers and police.
8 killed in a border/land dispute between Luo / Maasai and Kisii militia groups.
Police disperse a gathering of pro-democracy supporters with whips and clubs. Protesters respond by hurling stones at the police.
Raiders killed four civilians in a Nairobi slum.
A police officer was killed by a mob as he tried to arrest a suspect.
Opposition supporters protest in a Nairobi Park.
Riot police fired tear gas into a opposition rally gathering in order to disperse them.
Cattle thieves steal cattle from their owners.
Cattle thieves shoot two police dead as they fled them.
Hundreds of residents rioted in protest of increasing bandits attacks. Cars were burned, shops were looted and a large building fell victim to an arson attack.
Three civilians bystanders are killed during a gun battle between police and a armed group.
Armed bandits shoot and kill nine police in a gun battle.
Raid in Turkana District - Kenyan government demanded compensation from Uganda (details of the attack not specified) - 21 killed and 16 injured
31 Turkana nomads were killed and their cattle stolen in an attack by Ugandan Pokot raiders. Police retaliate and kill nine of the attackers. These events occurred over the course of a weekend.
Police defend Turkana cattle rearers, killing nine of their Pokot attackers. These events occurred over the course of a weekend.
Raid in Turkana District - Kenyan government demanded compensation from Uganda (details of the attack not specified)
Bandits kill a police chief and four other officers in an ambush, hacking their bodies with machetes.
Assailants armed with clubs and a firearm beat and robbed a group of German campers on the grounds of a gaming reserve.
Police shoot dead a unidentified gunman in a Mombasa suburb.
Police hunt down and kill eight men accused of killing five in a previous attack.
Police shoot dead a unidentified gunman in a Mombasa suburb.
Raiders attack a police station, police retaliate killing two.
Armed raiders attack British tourists on a bus, causing them to flee. A Kenyan was killed in the attack
Raiders attack shops and curio stalls in a resort area.
Unidentified raiders hacked to death six in a Mombasa suburb restaurant.
A bar owner was shot dead when gangsters raided his business. Two patrons were injured.
A man was attacked then shot by gangsters in his home.
Gunmen kill two civilians and shoot a policeman in a church.
On 20 August 1997, coastal vigilante villagers lynch two men because they believed they planned to cause violence. [size=no report]
Raiders attacked and burned more than 300 souvenir stalls, injuring several people.
A raider was killed by police as his group ran into a police ambush. Others arrested.
An armed group burns a bar and several houses to the ground.
An armed group kills a civilian in a Mombasa suburb.
A raider is killed by vigilante villagers outside of Mombasa.
Two killed during a raid on a Mombasa area slum.
Waves of gangs kill 30 in a Mombasa tourist market.
An armed group kills a civilian in a Mombasa suburb.
Five killed by raiders at a Nairobi area slum known as Kongowea.
Bodies of police found, victims of the ongoing violence in and around Mombasa.
Six are killed in an overnight police battle in a Mombasa slum.
Arsonists set ablaze 100 roadside trading kiosks and dozens of houses. Five killed.
The bodies of two policemen, missing since the violence of 8/16/97, were found in Kaya Bombo Forest, NW of Waa.
Police kill three armed persons while on a manhunt for attackers of a police station. Three houses were burnt during the scuffle.
Police kill an armed person at a tourist village northeast of Mombasa.
Police battle armed youths following the murder and police and civilians. The police believed the youths were involved.
Police arrest twenty in connection with a Mombasa police station attack.
Armed attackers kill six police officers and seven civilians at a police station in Mombasa.
Student rioters burn down a trading center, resulting in a temporally close of Egerton University.
Two police killed in a clash with opposition supporters.
One supporter of NARC is killed in a clash with police at Uhuru Park in Nairobi.
NARC members kill a man thought to be a KANU or police spy at a rally.
Ruling party and opposition party supporters clash in Nairobi, throwing stones at each other.
Bandits kill three cattle trading businessmen, stealing their cattle. One of the businessmen is identified as Muhammad Aliyo.
Student rioters demanding constitutional reforms briefly take control of a small portion of highway in Nairobi. Rioting has carried over from the previous day.
Police battle student rioters protesting constitutional reforms.
Police battle stone throwing student rioters who chanted anti-Moi slogans in Nairobi.
University students protest killings by police in Nairobi.
Police units stormed Nairobi University, firing teargas to disperse defiant protesters who are lighting cars on fire. Fifteen die later in a hospital.
The day following the breakup of a demonstration in Nairobi police fire live rounds into a small crowd of those lingering and kill eight, including one police officer through collateral damage.
A policeman is shot and wounded while trying disperse protesters.
Seven bystanders are shot and killed by an unknown armed group.
On 7 July 1997, police armed with batons forcefully break up an opposition protest in Nairobi's Uhuru Park (Starehe, Nairobi) and killed 3. [size=no report]
On 7 July 1997, a small boy was killed by the police during protests in Thika (Thika Town, Kiambu). [size=no report]
Students of Jomo Kenyatta University riot over the intended repeal of the Public Universities Act. The rioting caused the burning down of an office block.
Police use tear gas to quell student rioters.
Police clashed with stone throwing students in Nairobi as they protest the expulsion of those who did not pay their student fees.
Students protest in Nairobi over the expulsion of those not paying student fees.
Police disperse opposition protesters who were demanding constitutional reform.
Students stoned motorists and police while marching to parliament to demand constitutional reforms. Police fired tear gas. 7 students and 3 police injured.
MPs from opposing political parties throw punches inside parliament over budget talks.
Unknown group use iron bars to attack 3 Polish nuns at residence of an archbishop. Attack suspected to be connected to archbishops stance on justice in the country.
Tribal fighting cause the death of a worker and the closure of voter registration facility.
Rioters demanding constitutional reforms set up burning barricades and smashed windows of shops. Police fired tear gas, rubber bullets and beat rioters.

assoc_actor_1: Military Forces of Kenya (1978-2002) General Service Unit
notes: 700 rioters demanding constitutional reforms set up burning barricades, smashed windows of shops, and threw stones at police. Police fired tear gas, rubber bullets and beat rioters.
Clashes between Pokot and Marakwet militia along Kerio River. 15 dead over two days (8 fatalities coded for May 12, 7 fatalities coded for May 14).
Clashes between Pokot and Marakwet militia along Kerio River. 15 dead over two days (8 fatalities coded for May 12, 7 fatalities coded for May 14).

assoc_actor_1: NARC: National Rainbow Coalition; FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
actor2: Military Forces of Kenya (1978-2002) General Service Unit
notes: One killed and six injured when opposition rioters burnt KANU offices in protest of the Public Order Act. General Services Unit fired tear gas and beat rioters. One motorist beaten to dead. Police deny any fatalities occurred.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Kenya (1978-2002) General Service Unit
notes: Police and General Service Unit shoot dead seven Pokot cattle thieves over a two-day battle (4 fatalities coded for May 1, 3 fatalities coded for May 2). 90 militiamen suspected to have drowned in Kerio River while escaping.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Kenya (1978-2002) General Service Unit
notes: Police and General Service Unit shoot dead seven Pokot cattle thieves over a two-day battle (4 fatalities coded for May 1, 3 fatalities coded for May 2). Up to 90 militiamen suspected to have drowned in Kerio River while escaping.
Gunmen shot and killed prominent Kenyan criminal lawyer Samuel Ndubgi.
Street hawkers gather at Nairobi city council offices in protest of confiscated goods and the arrest of a colleague.
200 protesters in support of NARC MP Charity Nguilu gathered at her home in Kitui. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd.

assoc_actor_2: Private Security Forces (Kenya); FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
notes: Riot police shot and seriously wounded a bodyguard of FORD opposition leader Michael Kijana Wamalwa in Kakamega.
Police beat up opposition MPs Oburu and Raila Odinga, sons of former opposiiton leader Odinga Odinga in Eldoret.
Police forces kill six cattle thieves and recover nearly 2,000 head of cattle. The thieves numbered 60.
Raiders from Ethiopia attack Kenyans
Ethiopian raiders clash with Kenyan security forces
Ethiopian bandits kill 16 policemen who engaged them following a raid on a village.
Ethiopian bandits kill 80 and steal their cattle.
Ethiopian raiders attack and kill Kenyan civilians
Ethiopian raiders clash with Kenyan security forces
Kenya Polytechnic students protested the death of a Nairobi student that occurred a few days prior. Police with clubs broke up the demonstration. No reports of injuries.
Third day of students protesting after death of fellow student leader.
Second day of students rioting after death of fellow student leader.
Egerton University students in Nakuru protested the death of a University of Nairobi student.

A student leader is killed after a bomb explodes in his dorm room. It is possible that this incident was an accident, but it could be intentional, as his had a history of political involvement and had received death threats in the past.
Hundreds of University of Nairobi students took to the streets protesting the suspected murder of a fellow student leader. Many created barricades and threw stones at passing cars.
Armed raiders from Ethiopia cross the Kenyan border, killed eight and rode away with a large number of livestock.
Two members of Safina party and bystanders were attacked by police in Nyeri.
Roman Catholic Church leaders protest the police killing of an Irish priest on Jan 22.
Two Somali refugees are burnt to death when a fire, started by Giriama tribesmen, swept through their camp. 14,000 were also left homeless due to the fire.
Police shot and killed an Irish priest (Fr. Larry Timmons) in his home after he confronted them over alleged corruption at an earlier time. The priest was a missionary Nakuru.

assoc_actor_2: Samburu Ethnic Group (Kenya); Turkana Ethnic Group (Kenya)
notes: Police cause unknown number of fatalities as they attempt to chase cattle rustlers from their land following the shooting down of an Army helicopter.
